books.title: The Murder of Roger Ackroyd
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A legendary Belgian detective comes out of retirement to investigate a friend’s murder.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: My Reminiscences
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Autobiographical sketches from the Bengali writer, poet, and artist Rabindranath Tagore.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: The Blue Bird
books.author: Maurice Maeterlinck
books.summary: Two children go on a magical adventure in search of the Blue Bird.

books.title: Leave It to Psmith
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Psmith inveigles himself into Blandings Castle to help out a friend and to pursue love.

books.title: The Eumenides
books.author: Aeschylus
books.summary: A man is pursued by wrathful goddesses for avenging his father’s murder, and finds refuge in Athens where a trial determines his fate.

books.title: Domnei
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: The tale of to what extent a woman’s love is worth pursuing.

books.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
books.author: Alexandre Dumas
books.summary: A man seeks revenge for having been falsely imprisoned years earlier.

books.title: Melmoth the Wanderer
books.author: Charles Robert Maturin
books.summary: A set of overlapping tales tell the story of a mysterious, malevolent, ageless stranger.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.

books.title: The Rasp
books.author: Philip MacDonald
books.summary: A retired colonel investigates the elaborate murder of a cabinet minister.

books.title: Democracy and Social Ethics
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams argues that addressing social issues like poverty and inequality requires shifting from individual morality to a collective understanding of social responsibility.

books.title: The City of God
books.author: Augustine of Hippo
books.summary: Bishop Augustine of Hippo provides a defense of the Christian faith against its pagan critics, as well as explaining God’s work and purposes in world history, from beginning to end.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: Jack Keefe Stories
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A boastful, nearly illiterate major league pitcher writes a series of letters home detailing the goings-on in his life and career.

books.title: The Food of the Gods
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: Two scientists discover a substance which promotes rapid and extreme growth in plants, animals, and humans, leading to unexpected and alarming consequences.

books.title: Ukridge Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of stories featuring P. G. Wodehouse’s charismatic character Stanley Featherstonehaugh Ukridge.

books.title: Practical Mysticism
books.author: Evelyn Underhill
books.summary: Evelyn Underhill makes the case that mysticism is accessible and beneficial to everyone.

books.title: To Cuba and Back
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A captivating travel memoir recounting an 1859 journey to Cuba, offering vivid descriptions of the island’s culture, landscapes, and people.
